page.title: 14WHIPPENDELL WOOD
page.content: {Whippendell Woods}is a big 161 acre wood owned by Watford Borough Council. It is surrounded by lovely countryside and is very peaceful.It has 250 diff- erent flowering plants, 58 different birds,21 mammals and 40 spiders. Most people come from local towns and villages by car.The woods are just there for people to enjoy and to help conserve wildlife.There is a warden employed by the council to look after the wildlife and foresters to manage the woods.People use the woods for walking or jogging,horseriding or to exercise their dogs(but they must be kept on a lead).Visitors can take a picnic to one of the special picnic areas,where there are wooden tables,benches and bins disguised as trees.Some of the rules include no guns,no fires,no litter and no ball games.
